extendedIngredients.name: chile
extendedIngredients.original: 1 Fresno chile, finely chopped, or 1 1/2 teaspoons ground red pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: Fresno chile, finely chopped, or 1 1/2 teaspoons ground red pepper

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 16 jumbo shrimp, tails on and deveined

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.original: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.original: 4 scallions, white parts finely chopped and green parts thinly sliced on an angle

title: Prosciutto Wrapped Chile Shrimp with Green Onions
summary: You can never have too many hor d'oeuvre recipes, so give Prosciutto Wrapped Chile Shrimp with Green Onions a try. Watching your figure? This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe has 259 calories, 9g of protein, and 24g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 4 and costs $1.88 per serving. This recipe from Foodnetwork has 5 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 10 minutes. Head to the store and pick up evoo, prosciutto, juice of lemon, and a few other things to make it today. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 30%, which is rather bad. Similar recipes include Grilled Prosciutto Wrapped Shrimp and Arugula Salad with Pickled Onions, and Balsamic Reduction, Easy Prosciutto-Wrapped Shrimp, and Prosciutto Wrapped Glazed Shrimp.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: GIFFT Pinot Grigio bursts with lively pear and tropical fruits, balanced by crisp acidity and an elegantly refined freshness. Featuring ripe stone fruit and citrus aromas, this wine showcases melon, nectarine and Meyer lemon flavors that finish light and refreshing.

instructions: Heat a grill or grill pan to medium.                          Combine the EVOO, scallion whites, chile and lemon juice in a medium bowl and season with salt and pepper. Add the shrimp and toss to coat. Wrap each shrimp with a slice of prosciutto and thread onto a skewer.                          Grill the shrimp until firm and opaque, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a serving platter and garnish with the scallion greens and another squeeze of lemon juice.

steps.step: Heat a grill or grill pan to medium.
Combine the EVOO, scallion whites, chile and lemon juice in a medium bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Add the shrimp and toss to coat. Wrap each shrimp with a slice of prosciutto and thread onto a skewer.
Grill the shrimp until firm and opaque, about 3 minutes per side.
Transfer to a serving platter and garnish with the scallion greens and another squeeze of lemon juice.
